info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 01 at 10:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following areas, Charleston and Tidal Berkeley. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - While the heaviest rainfall has generally ended, moderate to occasionally heavy rain will continue to impact much of Charleston County through the night. Additional rainfall amounts of an inch will be possible, with locally higher amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
